Pre-Game Insights: The St. Louis Cardinals will continue their three-game series with the New York Yankees on Saturday at Yankee Stadium.
Kyle Gibson will start for the Cardinals with a record of 7-6 and a 4.54 ERA.
Will Warren will start for the Yankees with a record of 0-2 and a 9.68 ERA.
The Cardinals are trailing the final wildcard spot by six games and need to start winning now.
Masyn Winn leads the Cardinals in hits and has greatly improved from last season.
Alex Burleson leads the Cardinals in home runs and is a threat at the plate.
Nolan Arenado is consistent and a major threat at the plate.
Paul Goldschmidt can still clobber the baseball if he finds the right pitch.
Ryan Helsley is the best closer in baseball with a record of 6-4 and a 2.38 ERA with 41 saves in 44 chances.
The Yankees are currently the best team in the American League and are pushing to obtain the top seed and home-field advantage throughout the AL Playoffs.
Aaron Judge has 51 home runs and 123 RBIs and has a chance to beat his own 62-home run record.
Juan Soto has been an excellent addition to the Yankees' lineup.
Jazz Chisholm is the newest Yankee and has done well over the past few weeks.
The Yankees' bullpen is seventh in baseball in team ERA.
